examples/sparql.php
Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Use QueryPath to query SPARQL endpoints on semantic web servers.
00004  *
00005  * This example runs a SPARQL query against a remote database server
00006  * ({@link http://dbpedia.org}) and then parses the returned XML data, 
00007  * displaying it as an HTML table.
00008  *
00009  * This demo shows how a more complex GET query can be built up in 
00010  * QueryPath. POST queries are supported, too. Use a stream context
00011  * to create those.
00012  *
00013  * 
00014  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00015  * @license LGPL The GNU Lesser GPL (LGPL) or an MIT-like license.
00016  * @see http://www.w3.org/2009/sparql/wiki/Main_Page
00017  * @see http://dbpedia.org
00018  * @see dbpedia.php
00019  * @see musicbrainz.php
00020  * @see http://drupal.org/project/querypath
00021  */
00022  
00023 require '../src/QueryPath/QueryPath.php';
00024 
00025 // We are using the dbpedia database to execute a SPARQL query.
00026 
00027 // URL to DB Pedia's SPARQL endpoint.
00028 $url = 'http://dbpedia.org/sparql';
00029 
00030 // The SPARQL query to run.
00031 $sparql = '
00032   PREFIX foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/>
00033   PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
00034   SELECT ?uri ?name ?label
00035   WHERE {
00036     ?uri foaf:name ?name .
00037     ?uri rdfs:label ?label
00038     FILTER (?name = "The Beatles")
00039     FILTER (lang(?label) = "en")
00040   }
00041 ';
00042 
00043 // We first set up the parameters that will be sent.
00044 $params = array(
00045   'query' => $sparql,
00046   'format' => 'application/sparql-results+xml',
00047 );
00048 
00049 // DB Pedia wants a GET query, so we create one.
00050 $data = http_build_query($params);
00051 $url .= '?' . $data;
00052 
00053 // Next, we simply retrieve, parse, and output the contents.
00054 $qp = qp($url, 'head');
00055 
00056 // Get the headers from the resulting XML.
00057 $headers = array();
00058 foreach ($qp->children('variable') as $col) {
00059   $headers[] = $col->attr('name');
00060 }
00061 
00062 // Get rows of data from result.
00063 $rows = array();
00064 $col_count = count($headers);
00065 foreach ($qp->top()->find('results>result') as $row) {
00066   $cols = array();
00067   $row->children();
00068   for ($i = 0; $i < $col_count; ++$i) {
00069     $cols[$i] = $row->branch()->eq($i)->text();
00070   }
00071   $rows[] = $cols;
00072 }
00073 
00074 // Turn data into table.
00075 $table = '<table><tr><th>' . implode('</th><th>', $headers) . '</th></tr>';
00076 foreach ($rows as $row) {
00077   $table .= '<tr><td>';
00078   $table .= implode('</td><td>', $row);
00079   $table .= '</td></tr>';
00080 }
00081 $table .= '</table>';
00082 
00083 // Add table to HTML document.
00084 qp(QueryPath::HTML_STUB, 'body')->append($table)->writeHTML();
